data.text:
Agnes Day1

F, #272901, d. May 1839

Last Edited=9 Mar 2008

Consanguinity Index=0.05%

Agnes Day was the daughter of Reverend John Day and Arabella Godfrey.1,2 She married James Butler, son of Whitwell Butler and Belinda Yeilding, in 1817.1 She died in May 1839.1

From 1817, her married name became Butler.

Children of Agnes Day and James Butler

John Butler3 d. Jul 1854

Arabella Agnes Butler3

Belinda Butler3

James Butler+1 b. 28 May 1820, d. 26 Oct 1887

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1214. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S31] Bernard, Sir Burke, editor, Burke's genealogical and heraldic history of the landed gentry of Ireland, 4th ed. (London, U.K.: Burkes Peerage Ltd, 1958), page 217. Hereinafter cited as Landed Gentry of Ireland.

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

James Butler1

M, #272902, b. 28 May 1820, d. 26 October 1887

Last Edited=9 Mar 2008

Consanguinity Index=0.01%

James Butler was born on 28 May 1820.1 He was the son of James Butler and Agnes Day.1 He married Anne Margaret Davis, daughter of Roger Green Davis, on 28 October 1847.1 He died on 26 October 1887 at age 67.1

He lived at Waterville, Ireland .1 He held the office of Justice of the Peace (J.P.)1

Children of James Butler and Anne Margaret Davis

Theobald Butler+2 d. 1946

Anne Margaret Davis1

F, #272904, d. 30 March 1903

Last Edited=9 Mar 2008

Anne Margaret Davis was the daughter of Roger Green Davis.1 She married James Butler, son of James Butler and Agnes Day, on 28 October 1847.1 She died on 30 March 1903.1

From 28 October 1847, her married name became Butler.

George Albert Bromet1

M, #272905, b. 1861

Last Edited=9 Mar 2008

George Albert Bromet was born in 1861 at Tadcaster, Yorkshire, England .1 He was the son of John Addinell Bromet and Elizabeth Smith.1 He married Ellen Isabel Robinson in 1888 at Marylebone, London, England .1

Children of George Albert Bromet and Ellen Isabel Robinson

Freda C. Bromet1 b. 1889

Air Vice-Marshal Sir Geoffrey Rhodes Bromet+1 b. 28 Aug 1891, d. 16 Nov 1983

Mary Goyne Stevens1

F, #272907, d. 25 April 1938

Last Edited=8 Mar 2008

Mary Goyne Stevens was the daughter of William Goyne Stevens.1 She married James Edward Butler, son of James Butler and Anne Margaret Davis, on 24 February 1897.1 She died on 25 April 1938.1

From 24 February 1897, her married name became Butler.

Children of Mary Goyne Stevens and James Edward Butler

Arabella Agnes Butler d. 3 Sep 1969

James Whitwell Butler+1 b. 19 Oct 1897, d. 22 Dec 1971

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1214. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

James Whitwell Butler1

M, #272908, b. 19 October 1897, d. 22 December 1971

Last Edited=5 Jul 2015

James Whitwell Butler was born on 19 October 1897.1 He was the son of James Edward Butler and Mary Goyne Stevens.1 He married Hilda Winifred Haines, daughter of Charles Nason Haines, on 24 March 1927.1 He died on 22 December 1971 at age 74.1,2

He was educated at Trent College, England .1 He fought in the First World War.1 He was educated at Royal Military College, Sandhurst, Berkshire, England .1 He fought in the Second World War.1 He gained the rank of Major in the 8th King's Royal Irish Hussars and Pioneer Corps.1 He lived at The Precincts, Rosscarbery, County Cork, Ireland .1

Children of James Whitwell Butler and Hilda Winifred Haines

James Charles Butler+1 b. 5 May 1928

Edward Theobald Butler+1 b. 9 May 1929, d. 1992

Hilda Elizabeth Butler+3 b. 14 Apr 1932

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 1, page 1214. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]
